data.title: Pipes & Drums of CPF
data.text:
In the grand tradition of honoring fallen colleagues, the Pipes and Drums of California Professional Firefighters was created to perform at funerals and memorial services honoring California firefighters who have died in the line of duty.

Since its inception in 1999, the Pipes and Drums has grown from a few members to 26 individuals. Each musician is a paid, career or retired firefighter, whose participation in the Band is entirely on a volunteer basis.

The Pipes and Drums of California Professional Firefighters creates a dignified, traditional presence at the annual California Firefighters Memorial in California State Capitol Park, Sacramento. Playing in the great tradition of Scottish bagpipe bands, the group lends an air of dignity and honor to those who have made the ultimate sacrifice.

Please contact us at cafirefoundation@cpf.org for more information or to inquire about the bandâ€™s availability.

The current membership of the Pipes and Drums of California Professional Firefighters:

Dane Bode, Los Angeles County

Rodney Cordero, Salinas

Tracey Hansen, Cosumnes

Jeremy Hoag, Fremont

Mark Howell, Pinole

Mark Lundquist, Orange County

Kelcey Sass, Vista

Aaron Wham, Sacramento Metro

John Williamson, Del Mar
